constituent: shop, cottage, little-thatch, umbrella, earthenware jar, lidded crock, soil, dirt, ground, mouth, dog-tag, arrowhead, screwdriver, utilize, utilise
heisigStory: Cottage . . . dog tag. The key word refers to the noun, not the verb.
koohiiStory1: A shop in an impoverished country is just a cottage with a dog tag identifying it.
koohiiStory2: Normal cottages (舎 actually means a building) don´t have tags advertising their names, but shops do.
words: 舗装(ほそう): pavement, road surface
